newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 16.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
A meeting of cotton industry officials said the state should retain control over the national cotton industry while working to speed up technical reform.
A commentary said Taiwan's effort to win a seat in the United Nations was wrong and the island's attempts to split the motherland did not have support of the Chinese people.
A second Tibet company, Tibet Jinzhu Co Ltd, is to issue 13.5 million A shares in Shanghai.
State Council issues new guidelines on fixed asset investment, saying that financing must be arranged before investment projects will be allowed to proceed.
Chinese Vice Premier Zhu Rongji said the Chinese economy was performing at its best since 1993.
